title: Drew Hub - Modern SaaS Platform
description: A comprehensive SaaS platform built with Next.js 14, featuring blog engine, CMS dashboard, authentication, and modern UI components.

body.raw:
# Drew Hub - Modern SaaS Platform Drew Hub is a comprehensive, production-ready SaaS platform that demonstrates modern web development best practices. Built with Next.js 14 and TypeScript, it features a complete blog engine, CMS dashboard, authentication system, and custom UI components. ## Features ### ðŸš€ Core Technology Stack - **Next.js 14** with App Router and Server Components - **TypeScript** for type safety throughout the application - **Tailwind CSS** with custom design system - **Prisma** for type-safe database operations - **Clerk** for authentication and user management - **PlanetScale** for serverless MySQL database ### ðŸ“ Blog Engine - **MDX Support** for rich content authoring - **Contentlayer** for content management - **Algolia Search** integration for fast content discovery - **RSS/Atom Feeds** for content syndication - **Dynamic Sitemap** generation for SEO - **Tag-based Organization** with filtering capabilities ### ðŸŽ›ï¸ CMS Dashboard - **Admin Interface** for content management - **Analytics Dashboard** with key performance indicators - **CRUD Operations** for posts and projects - **Drag-and-Drop** project reordering - **User Management** and settings configuration - **Newsletter Management** with subscriber analytics ### ðŸŽ¨ Modern UI/UX - **Custom Design System** built on Tailwind CSS - **shadcn/ui Components** for consistent interface elements - **Responsive Design** optimized for all devices - **Dark Mode** support with system preference detection - **Accessibility** compliant with WCAG guidelines - **Performance Optimized** with Core Web Vitals focus ### ðŸ”’ Security & Authentication - **Clerk Integration** for secure user authentication - **Role-based Access Control** for different user types - **API Route Protection** with middleware - **CSRF Protection** and security headers - **Content Security Policy** implementation ## Technical Implementation ### Architecture Decisions #### App Router Implementation ```typescript // app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx import { notFound } from 'next/navigation' import { allPosts } from 'contentlayer/generated' import { MDXContent } from '@/components/mdx/mdx-content' export async function generateStaticParams() { return allPosts.map((post) => ({ slug: post.slug, })) } export default function BlogPost({ params }: { params: { slug: string } }) { const post = allPosts.find((post) => post.slug === params.slug) if (!post) { notFound() } return (

{post.title}

{post.description}

) } ``` #### Database Schema Design ```prisma model Post { id String @id @default(cuid()) title String slug String @unique description String content String @db.Text published Boolean @default(false) featured Boolean @default(false) createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt // Relations author User @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id]) authorId String tags PostTag[] @@map("posts") } ``` #### API Route Implementation ```typescript // app/api/posts/route.ts import { NextRequest } from 'next/server' import { auth } from '@clerk/nextjs/server' import { db } from '@/lib/db' import { createPostSchema } from '@/lib/validations/post' export async function POST(request: NextRequest) { try { const { userId } = auth() if (!userId) { return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 }) } const body = await request.json() const validatedData = createPostSchema.parse(body) const post = await db.post.create({ data: { ...validatedData, authorId: userId, slug: slugify(validatedData.title), }, }) return Response.json({ post }, { status: 201 }) } catch (error) { return handleApiError(error) } } ``` ### Performance Optimizations #### Image Optimization - **Next.js Image Component** for automatic optimization - **WebP/AVIF** format support with fallbacks - **Lazy Loading** with intersection observer - **Responsive Images** with appropriate sizing #### Caching Strategy ```typescript // lib/cache.ts import { unstable_cache } from 'next/cache' export const getCachedPosts = unstable_cache( async () => { return await db.post.findMany({ where: { published: true }, orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' }, include: { author: true, tags: true }, }) }, ['posts'], { revalidate: 3600 } // 1 hour ) ``` #### Bundle Optimization - **Dynamic Imports** for code splitting - **Tree Shaking** to eliminate unused code - **Compression** with gzip/brotli - **CDN Integration** for static assets ## Development Workflow ### Code Quality - **ESLint** with strict TypeScript rules - **Prettier** for consistent code formatting - **Husky** for pre-commit hooks - **Conventional Commits** for better git history ### Testing Strategy ```typescript // __tests__/components/blog-post.test.tsx import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react' import { BlogPost } from '@/components/blog/blog-post' const mockPost = { id: '1', title: 'Test Post', description: 'Test description', content: 'Test content', createdAt: new Date(), } describe('BlogPost', () => { it('renders post title and content', () => { render() expect(screen.getByText('Test Post')).toBeInTheDocument() expect(screen.getByText('Test description')).toBeInTheDocument() }) }) ``` ### CI/CD Pipeline ```yaml # .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml name: CI/CD Pipeline on: push: branches: [main] pull_request: branches: [main] jobs: test: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: actions/setup-node@v4 with: node-version: '18' cache: 'npm' - run: npm ci - run: npm run lint - run: npm run type-check - run: npm run test - run: npm run build ``` ## Deployment & Infrastructure ### Vercel Deployment - **Edge Functions** for optimal performance - **Analytics** integration for monitoring - **Environment Variables** management - **Preview Deployments** for pull requests ### Database Strategy - **PlanetScale** for serverless MySQL - **Branch-based Development** for schema changes - **Connection Pooling** for optimal performance - **Backup and Recovery** procedures ### Monitoring & Analytics - **Vercel Analytics** for performance metrics - **Error Tracking** with Sentry integration - **User Analytics** with privacy-focused solutions - **Core Web Vitals** monitoring ## Learning Outcomes This project demonstrates proficiency in: 1. **Modern React Patterns** - Server Components, Suspense, Error Boundaries 2. **Full-Stack Development** - API design, database modeling, authentication 3. **Performance Optimization** - Caching strategies, image optimization, Core Web Vitals 4. **DevOps Practices** - CI/CD pipelines, testing strategies, deployment automation 5. **User Experience** - Responsive design, accessibility, progressive enhancement ## Future Enhancements ### Planned Features - [ ] **Multi-tenant Architecture** for SaaS scaling - [ ] **Advanced Analytics** with custom dashboards - [ ] **Email Marketing** integration - [ ] **Payment Processing** with Stripe - [ ] **API Rate Limiting** and usage analytics - [ ] **Content Localization** for international users ### Technical Improvements - [ ] **Edge Computing** optimization - [ ] **Database Sharding** for scalability - [ ] **Real-time Features** with WebSockets - [ ] **Progressive Web App** capabilities - [ ] **Advanced Caching** with Redis - [ ] **Microservices** architecture migration ## Repository Structure ``` drew-hub/ â”œâ”€â”€ .github/workflows/ # CI/CD pipelines â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js app directory â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # Reusable React components â”œâ”€â”€ content/ # MDX content files â”œâ”€â”€ lib/ # Utility functions and configurations â”œâ”€â”€ prisma/ # Database schema and migrations â”œâ”€â”€ public/ # Static assets â”œâ”€â”€ styles/ # Global styles and Tailwind config â””â”€â”€ types/ # TypeScript type definitions ``` This project serves as a comprehensive example of modern web development practices, demonstrating how to build scalable, maintainable, and performant web applications using the latest technologies and best practices.

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx
import { notFound } from 'next/navigation'
import { allPosts } from 'contentlayer/generated'
import { MDXContent } from '@/components/mdx/mdx-content'

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  return allPosts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }))
}

export default function BlogPost({ params }: { params: { slug: string } }) {
  const post = allPosts.find((post) => post.slug === params.slug)
  
  if (!post) {
    notFound()
  }

  return (
    <article className="prose prose-lg max-w-4xl mx-auto">
      <header className="mb-8">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold">{post.title}</h1>
        <p className="text-xl text-gray-600 mt-4">{post.description}</p>
      </header>
      <MDXContent code={post.body.code} />
    </article>
  )
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-prisma",children:`model Post {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  title       String
  slug        String   @unique
  description String
  content     String   @db.Text
  published   Boolean  @default(false)
  featured    Boolean  @default(false)
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  // Relations
  author   User   @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id])
  authorId String
  tags     PostTag[]
  
  @@map("posts")

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// app/api/posts/route.ts
import { NextRequest } from 'next/server'
import { auth } from '@clerk/nextjs/server'
import { db } from '@/lib/db'
import { createPostSchema } from '@/lib/validations/post'

export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
  try {
    const { userId } = auth()
    if (!userId) {
      return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 })
    }

    const body = await request.json()
    const validatedData = createPostSchema.parse(body)

    const post = await db.post.create({
      data: {
        ...validatedData,
        authorId: userId,
        slug: slugify(validatedData.title),
      },
    })

    return Response.json({ post }, { status: 201 })
  } catch (error) {
    return handleApiError(error)
  }
}

import { unstable_cache } from 'next/cache'

export const getCachedPosts = unstable_cache(
  async () => {
    return await db.post.findMany({
      where: { published: true },
      orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' },
      include: { author: true, tags: true },
    })
  },
  ['posts'],
  { revalidate: 3600 } // 1 hour
)
